data.event: In 1867, it was granted town status and renamed Gornoye Grushevskoye Poseleniye (Горное Грушевское Поселение).
The name was changed to Alexandrovsk-Grushevsky (Александровск-Грушевский) in 1881.
1917 saw the city change hands three times, until it was taken on April 28, 1919, by the Don Army, under General Fitskhelaurov.
1917 saw the city change hands three times, until it was taken on April 28, 1919, by the Don Army, under General Fitskhelaurov.

event.title: twenty months it was independent of the Bolsheviks, but was ravaged

data.event: For twenty months it was independent of the Bolsheviks, but was ravaged by typhoid.
